newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pemex reports 10 mos. refining, petrochem activity.
newsitem.headline: Pemex reports 10 mos. refining, petrochem activity.

text.p: Mexico's state-owned oil and gas monopoly, Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex), said its refining division produced an average 497,700 barrels per day (bpd) of gasoline in the first 10 months of the year.
Pemex's gasoline refining rose 1.8 percent compared with the January-October period in 1995, the company said.
Mexico's diesel refining activity rose 4.1 percent in the same time period above 1995 levels, to 265,800 bpd.
Kerosene production, which includes jet fuel, averaged 70,100 bpd, a 13.3 percent drop from January to October output in 1995, Pemex said.

Fuel oil production in Pemex refineries reached 418,100 bpd in the first 10 months of the year, with 87,700 bpd of other petroleum byproducts, including industrial fuel, asphalt, coke, grease and lubricants.
Pemex reported its liquid gas production fell 0.6 percent to 253,700 bpd in the first 10 months of compared to the January to October period in 1995.
Pemex said, as a whole, its output of petroleum products in the first 10 months fell 0.4 percent from the same period a year earlier to an equivalent total of 1.59 million bpd of products.
